title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: The system should provide a dialog box with the message 'Do you want to save your file?' and options for 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel' (which halts the shutdown).
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer.

Expected Results:
A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
